message.content: This question requires knowledge about the purpose of containers with printed scales. A container with a printed scale on its side is typically used to measure volume. By filling the container with a substance, you can determine the volume of that substance based on the scale markings on the container. Option (A) is incorrect because measuring weight requires a scale, not a container with a printed scale. Option (B) is unrelated to the purpose of such containers. Option (C) is untrue because a container with a printed scale has no relevance to hearing through doors.

The scale indicates the amount of liquid or substance that is present in the container. Option (A) is incorrect because weight is measured using a scale, not a container with a printed scale. Option (B) is irrelevant because holding flowers is not the primary purpose of a container with a printed scale. Option (C) is incorrect because hearing through doors has nothing to do with a container's printed scale.
